content.description: A physical pendulum is constructed of a small block of mass <math alttext="2 m" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>2</mn> <mi>m</mi> </math> attached to the end of a uniform rod of length <math alttext="l" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>ℓ</mo></math> and mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>m</mi></math>. The rotational inertia of the rod about its end is <math alttext="one third , times m , script l squared" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mpadded><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mo>ℓ</mo><mn>2</mn></msup></mpadded></mstyle></math>. The rod is pulled back a small angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>θ</mi></math> and released at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, as shown. The rod is vertical at time <math alttext="t sub v" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>v</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which of the following is a correct expression for <math alttext="t sub v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>v</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="t sub v equals the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times the square root of the fraction 2 l over 15 g, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>v</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>ℓ</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t sub v equals, the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times the square root of the fraction 14 l over 15 g, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>v</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>14</mn><mo>ℓ</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t sub v equals, the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times the square root of the fraction l over g, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>v</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msqrt><mfrac><mo>ℓ</mo><mi>g</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t sub v equals, the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times the square root of the fraction 14 l over 5 g, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>v</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>14</mn><mo>ℓ</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="t sub v equals, the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times the square root of the fraction 14 l over 15 g, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>v</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>14</mn><mo>ℓ</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
